Articles.Content: Just an idle thought. I was flying over Kerbin and saw a textured, yet pretty much featureless, bathymetry exposed by shadows in my early morning takeoff. I would love it so much if Kerbin and other planets could be retextured with solid geological concepts in mind! Hmm...
Hmmmmmm, yes. Like mountains not splattered all over wherever the heck SQUAD feels like "moar mountains."

I think this applies to every map ever, books, movies, games... When you learn tectonics you can't help but seeing the mistakes. However I'd imagine that'd be a huge challenge, and it'd change Kerbin as we know it...

I think this applies to every map ever, books, movies, games... When you learn tectonics you can't help but seeing the mistakes. However I'd imagine that'd be a huge challenge, and it'd change Kerbin as we know it...

I couldn't agree with that any more. A realistic-looking Kerbin would be awesome, but that would be so difficult.
Being so small, Kerbin lost its internal heat ages ago, so has no plate tectonics. /fridgelogic

Being so small, Kerbin lost its internal heat ages ago, so has no plate tectonics. /fridgelogic

Given internal heat of planets is mostly maintained by radioactive decay, the size doesn't matter.

I couldn't agree with that any more. A realistic-looking Kerbin would be awesome, but that would be so difficult.

It wouldn't be that difficult. There's a rudimentary plate tectonics-based map generator by Laurence Mann on Sourceforge, and a thread on Gamedev.net.

Edit:

Edited March 8, 2014 by Accelerando
